intro: Hyophorbe lutescens, commonly known as the yellow hyophorbe, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and thick, fleshy stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Hyophorbe lutescens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
